Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Alo-2 (Alo2; MaK; knottin-type peptide;  3S=S, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: also isolated from Monochamus alternatus (Han et al., 2023). found in multiple species.Chemical modification:  C1-C4, C2-C5, and C3-C6.three disulfide bonds:Activity: active against  Gram+ B. thuringiensis (MIC 36.29 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli (MIC 36.29 ug/ml), and S. marcescens (MIC 72.58 ug/ml).nematocidal: It also inhibited pine wood nematodes nematocidal (LC50 0.362 mg/ml) after 48 h treatment.Toxicity: murine RBC: not hemo.lytic until 100 ug/ml (Cf.: melittin HC50 5 ug/ml).Peptide stability: no activity loss after treatment at 100oC for up to 60 min.Updated Jan2024
Literature Information.Author: Barbault F et al Vovelle F2003
Literature Information.Title: Solution structure of Alo-3: a new knottin-type antifungal peptide from the insect Acrocinus longimanus
